3.description: Now serving as Hand of the King while Tywin fights in the Riverlands. Struggling with the challenges of governance.

8.description: Begins forming the plan to create wildfire for the defense of King's Landing. Shows strategic military thinking.

58.description: Leads the defense of King's Landing during the Battle of the Blackwater. Uses wildfire to destroy Stannis's fleet.

62.description: Severely wounded in battle, disfigured by a sword cut across his face. Recovery uncertain.

relationships.Tywin Lannister: Father arrives to save the city

5.description: Captured on the road and taken prisoner by Lannister forces. Hair cut short, disguised as a boy named 'Arry'.

14.description: Taken to Harrenhal as a servant. Witnesses the horrible conditions and torture within the castle.

30.description: Uses her first 'name' with Jaqen H'ghar, choosing the Tickler who tortured prisoners.

47.description: Uses her second name on Ser Amory Lorch after he nearly discovers her identity through a letter.

64.description: Escapes Harrenhal with Hot Pie and Gendry after using her third name creatively to force Jaqen to help them escape.

6.description: Ranging beyond the Wall with the Night's Watch, searching for Benjen Stark and investigating wildling activity.

23.description: Part of the great ranging beyond the Wall. The Night's Watch seeks to learn what happened to the missing rangers.

43.description: Captured by wildlings after being ordered by Qhorin to kill him to maintain his cover. Must prove loyalty to Mance Rayder.

68.description: Successfully infiltrated the wildling army but struggles with divided loyalties as he grows closer to them.

12.description: Wandering the Red Waste with her small khalasar after Drogo's death. Her dragons are growing but still small.

27.description: Arrives at Qarth, the greatest city that ever was or will be. Welcomed by the Thirteen but with hidden agendas.

48.description: Her dragons are stolen and taken to the House of the Undying. She must venture into the mysterious tower to rescue them.

63.description: Successfully rescues her dragons from the House of the Undying, burning the warlocks with dragonfire. Leaves Qarth with ships.

7.description: Still recovering from his fall, now crippled from the waist down. Having strange dreams about a three-eyed crow.

21.description: His wolf dreams are becoming more vivid. He can slip into Summer's mind and experience the world through the direwolf's senses.

relationships.Osha: Wildling servant who understands his dreams

46.description: Theon Greyjoy captures Winterfell. Bran is taken prisoner in his own home by his father's former ward.

61.description: Escapes Winterfell's destruction with Hodor, Osha, Rickon, and the Reed children. Heads north toward the Wall.

10.description: Former smuggler turned loyal knight to Stannis Baratheon. Lost four fingertips to Stannis's justice years ago.

31.description: Leads Stannis's fleet toward King's Landing for the assault. Commands the flagship Black Betha named for his wife.

relationships.Devan Seaworth: His son serving as Stannis's squire

58.description: Survives the destruction of the fleet by wildfire at the Battle of the Blackwater, though barely.

11.description: Returns to the Iron Islands after nearly a decade as Ned Stark's ward. Hopes to win his father's respect and approval.

24.description: Disappointed that his father gives him only one ship while Asha gets thirty. Decides to prove himself by taking Winterfell.

46.description: Successfully captures Winterfell with a small force. Takes Bran and Rickon prisoner, claiming to be Prince of Winterfell.

relationships.Osha: Wildling who seems to serve him

61.description: Burns two boys' bodies and claims they are Bran and Rickon Stark, though the truth is more complex.

stannis-baratheon.name: Stannis Baratheon
aliases: The King in the Narrow Sea

15.description: Robert's middle brother who claims the Iron Throne by right. A hard, dutiful man who grinds his teeth.

25.description: Burns the Seven's sept on Dragonstone and declares for the Lord of Light. Many of his followers are disturbed by this change.

58.description: Leads the assault on King's Landing but is defeated by wildfire and the arrival of Tywin Lannister with the Tyrells.

15.description: Red priestess from Asshai who serves the Lord of Light. Has convinced Stannis that he is Azor Ahai reborn.

29.description: Uses mysterious shadow magic, though the exact purpose remains unclear to witnesses.

16.description: Robert's youngest brother who also claims the throne. Charismatic and well-loved, with the support of the Tyrells.

29.description: Experiences a shocking event in his tent that witnesses can barely comprehend.

22.description: Tall, strong woman warrior in Renly's Kingsguard. Mocked for her appearance but skilled with a sword.

29.description: Present during shocking events in Renly's tent. Blamed for what happened despite her innocence.

42.description: Swears service to Catelyn Stark and vows to find and protect her daughters.

16.description: Young daughter of Mace Tyrell, married to Renly Baratheon. Beautiful and courteous, brings the power of the Reach.

62.description: After events at Storm's End, the Tyrells ally with the Lannisters. She is now betrothed to King Joffrey.

39.description: Red-haired wildling woman who captures Jon Snow beyond the Wall. Mocks him for his vows and southern ways.

43.description: Part of the wildling force that Jon must prove his loyalty to. Shows him the ways of the free folk.

68.description: Her relationship with Jon deepens as he struggles between his Night's Watch vows and his mission.

1.description: Ned Stark's eldest son and heir, now leading the Northern army against the Lannisters in the Riverlands.

16.description: Winning battles against Lannister forces while trying to secure his father's release and avenge his death.

42.description: Forms alliance with potential allies while maintaining independence from both Stannis and Renly.

67.description: His war effort continues as he must deal with multiple fronts and the loss of Winterfell to Theon.

8.description: Robb's mother serving as his chief advisor in the war against the Lannisters. Grieves for Ned's death.

22.description: Negotiates with Renly Baratheon for a potential alliance against the Lannisters.

29.description: Witnesses shocking events involving shadow magic and is the only one to believe Brienne's innocence.

42.description: Takes Brienne into her service and sends her to find and protect Sansa and Arya.

relationships.Brienne of Tarth: Sworn sword tasked with finding her daughters

8.description: Catelyn's younger brother, now acting Lord of Riverrun while their father Hoster is ill.

16.description: Supports Robb's war effort and provides Riverlands forces to the Northern cause.

49.description: Eager for glory in battle but sometimes acts without strategic thinking, causing problems for the war effort.

8.description: Catelyn's uncle, a seasoned knight and military commander serving as Robb's advisor.

16.description: Provides experienced military leadership to the young king's forces. Respected veteran of Robert's Rebellion.

42.description: Continues to serve as one of Robb's most trusted advisors, bringing decades of military experience.

relationships.Robb Stark: One of his most trusted advisors

1.description: Massive Lord of Last Hearth, one of Robb's most fierce and loyal bannermen. Lost fingers to Grey Wind.

relationships.Robb Stark: Fierce loyalty to the Young Wolf
relationships.Grey Wind: Respects after losing fingers to the direwolf

16.description: Fights alongside Robb in the war, leading Umber forces with tremendous courage and strength.

33.description: One of Robb's most vocal supporters in the war councils, always ready for battle.

relationships.Other Northern lords: Respected for his loyalty and strength

1.description: Lord of Karhold and one of Robb's bannermen. Lost sons in the war and seeks vengeance against the Lannisters.

16.description: His grief over his sons' deaths drives him to seek bloody revenge against all Lannisters.

49.description: His desire for vengeance grows stronger, causing tension with Robb's more measured approach.

1.description: Quiet, pale Lord of the Dreadfort. One of Robb's bannermen but with a sinister reputation.

16.description: Leads Bolton forces in the war but his methods are often cruel and his loyalty seems calculating.

49.description: Continues to serve Robb but his actions suggest he may be looking out for his own interests.

1.description: Master of Deepwood Motte, a loyal Northern lord serving under Robb Stark.

16.description: Provides Glover forces to Robb's war effort, fighting against the Lannisters.

1.description: Lady of Bear Island, a fierce warrior woman who leads her own forces in battle.

16.description: Fights personally in battles alongside her daughters, wielding a spiked mace.

33.description: Continues to serve Robb faithfully, bringing the fierce loyalty of House Mormont to his cause.

1.description: Eldest daughter of Maege Mormont, a tall and strong warrior woman like her mother.

16.description: Fights alongside her mother and the Northern army, skilled with weapons and fearless in battle.

33.description: Continues to prove herself as a capable warrior in Robb's service.

3.description: Young king on the Iron Throne, cruel and impulsive. Son of Robert Baratheon and Cersei Lannister.

8.description: Shows increasing cruelty and disregard for advice, making governing difficult for Tyrion.

25.description: Continues to rule with cruelty and caprice while war rages around his kingdom.

62.description: Survives the Battle of the Blackwater and is now betrothed to Margaery Tyrell to secure the Tyrell alliance.

3.description: Queen Regent ruling for her son Joffrey. Resents Tyrion being named Hand of the King.

8.description: Constantly conflicts with Tyrion over governance and tries to maintain her influence over Joffrey.

36.description: Fears for her son's safety as Stannis approaches King's Landing with his fleet.

relationships.Stannis Baratheon: Fears his claim to the throne

60.description: During the Battle of the Blackwater, retreats to safety with the other noble ladies, drinking and fearing defeat.

relationships.Ser Ilyn Payne: Ready to execute hostages if the city falls

62.description: Relieved by the victory at Blackwater and the new alliance with the Tyrells, securing Joffrey's throne.

2.description: Held captive in King's Landing, betrothed to Joffrey but treated as a hostage after her father's execution.

17.description: Endures Joffrey's cruelty and public humiliation while maintaining her courtesy as armor.

relationships.Sandor Clegane: Only one who seems to care for her welfare

60.description: During the Battle of the Blackwater, kept with the other ladies, knowing she might be killed if the city falls.

relationships.Ser Ilyn Payne: Ready to execute her if needed

62.description: Freed from betrothal to Joffrey when he becomes engaged to Margaery Tyrell, but still a valuable hostage.

2.description: Joffrey's personal guard, a large man with a burned face who despises knights and their vows.

17.description: Often the only one to show mercy to Sansa during Joffrey's cruel punishments.

relationships.Sansa Stark: Protective of despite his rough manner

60.description: During the Battle of the Blackwater, abandons his post and flees the city, unable to face the fire.

14.description: Lord of Casterly Rock and head of House Lannister, now residing at Harrenhal commanding the war effort.

30.description: Uses Harrenhal as his base of operations, commanding Lannister forces against the Northern rebellion.

62.description: Arrives at King's Landing with Tyrell forces to save the city from Stannis, becoming Hand of the King.

relationships.Tyrion Lannister: Son who held the city until his arrival

30.description: Tywin's younger brother and most trusted lieutenant, helps command Lannister forces.

62.description: Serves his brother faithfully in the victory at King's Landing and helps establish the new regime.

3.description: Master of Coin on the Small Council, a cunning man who plays all sides for his own benefit.

17.description: Continues his schemes and manipulations, always working multiple angles for personal advancement.

62.description: Benefits from the Lannister victory and continues to advance his position through cunning.

3.description: Master of Whisperers, a eunuch who serves the realm with his network of spies and informants.

8.description: Provides intelligence to Tyrion while pursuing his own mysterious agenda for the good of the realm.

36.description: Continues to serve whoever holds power while maintaining his true loyalty to the realm itself.

3.description: Ancient Grand Maester who serves on the Small Council, loyal to House Lannister.

17.description: Continues his duties while showing clear preference for Cersei over Tyrion in his loyalties.

2.description: Royal executioner who cut out his own tongue years ago. Silent but deadly with Ice, Ned Stark's sword.

60.description: During the Battle of the Blackwater, positioned to execute hostages if the city falls to Stannis.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Ready to kill hostages at her command

11.description: Lord of the Iron Islands who declares himself king and launches a new rebellion against the mainland.
11.role: Self-proclaimed King of the Iron Islands

18.description: Plans to raid the North while Robb's forces are fighting in the South, seeing opportunity for conquest.

24.description: Gives Asha thirty ships while only giving Theon one, showing his preference for his daughter.

11.description: Balon's daughter and ship captain, mocks Theon for his time spent among mainlanders.

24.description: Commands thirty ships in the invasion of the North, far more than her brother received.

32.description: Leads successful raids in the North while Theon focuses on his single ship mission.

11.description: Balon's brother who commands the Iron Fleet, a proven warrior and naval commander.

18.description: Supports Balon's new rebellion and leads the Iron Fleet in attacks on the mainland.

11.description: Balon's brother who was exiled for his crimes and is said to be sailing strange seas.
Balon's brother who serves as a priest of the Drowned God, blessing the new rebellion.

18.description: Provides religious justification for the Iron Islands' return to the old ways of raiding.

24.description: Old raider who serves with Theon, experienced in the ironborn way of life and warfare.

32.description: Helps Theon capture Winterfell and provides counsel based on his experience.
Ironborn raider serving under Theon in the capture of Winterfell.
Ironborn captain who serves with Theon in occupying Winterfell.

3.description: Sellsword who serves as Tyrion's captain of guards and personal enforcer.

8.description: Helps Tyrion implement his plans for the city's defense, including the wildfire project.

60.description: Fights alongside Tyrion during the Battle of the Blackwater, proving his loyalty in battle.

3.description: Young woman who serves as Tyrion's secret lover, kept hidden from his family.

17.description: Provides comfort and companionship to Tyrion during the stresses of governing King's Landing.

36.description: Remains hidden during the preparations for battle, as Tyrion fears for her safety.

3.description: Young boy who serves as Tyrion's squire, quiet but loyal.

58.description: Saves Tyrion's life during the Battle of the Blackwater by killing a Kingsguard who attacked his master.

8.description: Commander of the City Watch under Tyrion, helps maintain order in King's Landing.

25.description: Works with Tyrion to prepare the city's defenses against Stannis's approaching forces.

58.description: Dies during the Battle of the Blackwater while defending the city.

8.description: Pyromancer and Wisdom of the Alchemists' Guild who produces wildfire for Tyrion's defense plans.

25.description: Continues producing massive quantities of wildfire for the defense of King's Landing.

58.description: His wildfire proves devastatingly effective against Stannis's fleet at the Battle of the Blackwater.

36.description: Kingsguard knight known for his emotionless demeanor and absolute obedience to orders.

58.description: Attempts to kill Tyrion during the Battle of the Blackwater but is killed by Podrick Payne.

36.description: Leader of the Burned Men mountain clan, serves Tyrion in exchange for steel and weapons.

58.description: Fights alongside Tyrion during the Battle of the Blackwater, proving the mountain clans' worth.

14.description: Lannister knight serving at Harrenhal under Tywin, known for his cruelty to prisoners.

47.description: Nearly discovers Arya's true identity through a letter but is killed by Jaqen H'ghar before he can reveal it.

relationships.Jaqen H'ghar: Killed by as Arya's second name

30.description: Enormous knight serving Tywin, known for his tremendous size, strength, and cruelty.

38.description: Leads raids and brutal attacks against enemy territories, spreading fear through his reputation.

47.description: His presence at Harrenhal adds to the castle's atmosphere of terror and brutality.

62.description: Lord of Horn Hill and one of the finest military commanders in Westeros, fights for the Tyrells.

67.description: Helps secure the Lannister-Tyrell victory at the Blackwater and the new alliance.

62.description: Lord of Goldengrove and Tyrell bannerman who participates in the relief of King's Landing.

67.description: Benefits from the Lannister-Tyrell alliance formed after their victory at the Blackwater.

10.description: Stannis's wife and queen, a stern woman who has converted to the Lord of Light alongside her husband.

25.description: Embraces the new faith of R'hllor and supports the burning of the sept on Dragonstone.

10.description: Stannis's young daughter, disfigured by greyscale on half her face but sweet-natured.

relationships.Stannis Baratheon: Father who loves her despite her disfigurement

15.description: Remains faithful to the Seven despite her parents' conversion to R'hllor, showing remarkable independence for her age.

relationships.Selyse Florent: Mother who disapproves of her faith

10.description: Shireen's fool who speaks in riddles and songs that sometimes seem prophetic. Survived drowning as a child.

15.description: His strange songs and prophecies disturb the adults but delight Shireen.

relationships.Melisandre: Makes her uneasy with his prophecies

10.description: Elderly maester who has served House Baratheon for decades, deeply concerned about Melisandre's influence.

15.description: Dies attempting to poison Melisandre during the feast, drinking the poisoned wine himself when she forces him to.

relationships.Davos Seaworth: Fellow opponent of the Red Woman

15.description: Young maester who replaces Cressen after his death, more accepting of the new religious changes.

25.description: Adapts to serving under the new religious regime, less resistant to Melisandre than his predecessor.

relationships.Melisandre: Does not oppose like Cressen did

10.description: Selyse's brother who serves as castellan of Dragonstone, eager supporter of Stannis's claim.

25.description: Zealously embraces the Lord of Light and supports the burning of those who refuse to convert.

31.description: Selyse's nephew who serves as admiral of Stannis's fleet during the attack on King's Landing.

58.description: His flagship is among those destroyed by the wildfire explosion during the Battle of the Blackwater.

relationships.Stannis's fleet: Lost with much of the navy

10.description: Lysene pirate admiral who provides ships to Stannis's fleet in exchange for promised rewards.

31.description: Commands his own ships in the assault on King's Landing, motivated by the promise of rich rewards.

10.description: Knight loyal to Stannis who serves in his court on Dragonstone.

25.description: Converts to worship of R'hllor alongside his king, abandoning the Seven.

10.description: Knight from House Estermont, related to Stannis through his mother's line, serves faithfully.

31.description: Participates in the assault on King's Landing as part of Stannis's forces.

25.description: Head of House Florent and Selyse's father, serves as Stannis's Hand of the King.

31.description: Advises Stannis on the assault plans and helps coordinate the attack on King's Landing.

15.description: Pious lord who refuses to abandon the Seven for R'hllor, opposing Stannis's religious conversion.

25.description: Imprisoned for refusing to burn the images of the Seven, maintaining his faith despite punishment.

15.description: Knight who refuses to convert to R'hllor and abandon the Seven, standing firm in his faith.

25.description: Burned alive as a sacrifice to R'hllor for refusing to convert, dying for his faith.

29.description: Bastard son of Lord Caron, serves Stannis after Renly's death when Storm's End surrenders.

33.description: Helps hold Storm's End for Stannis after its surrender, proving his loyalty.

10.description: Davos's eldest son, serves as a scribe and has converted to worship of R'hllor.

relationships.Davos Seaworth: Father who disagrees with his faith

17.description: Argues with his father about the truth of Melisandre's powers and the Lord of Light.

58.description: Dies in the wildfire explosion during the Battle of the Blackwater, devastating his father.

16.description: Young knight of exceptional skill and beauty, serves as Lord Commander of Renly's Rainbow Guard.

22.description: Leads the Rainbow Guard protecting Renly, famous for his tournament victories and chivalry.

29.description: Devastated by Renly's death, initially blames Brienne and seeks vengeance.

62.description: After the Blackwater, serves the new Lannister-Tyrell alliance, though still grieving Renly.

ser-bryce-caron.name: Bryce Caron
aliases: The Orange of Renly's Rainbow Guard

22.description: Member of Renly's Rainbow Guard, wearing orange and sworn to protect the king.

29.description: Present during Renly's death but helpless against the shadow that kills his king.

ser-guyard-morrigen.name: Guyard Morrigen
aliases: The Green of Renly's Rainbow Guard

22.description: Member of Renly's Rainbow Guard, wearing green and known for his loyalty to the young king.

29.description: Witnesses Renly's supernatural death and is forced to decide between the Baratheon brothers.

ser-robar-royce.name: Robar Royce
aliases: The Red of Renly's Rainbow Guard

22.description: Member of Renly's Rainbow Guard wearing red, son of Bronze Yohn Royce of the Vale.

29.description: Present when Renly is killed, initially suspects Brienne but comes to believe her innocence.

33.description: Dies trying to prevent Brienne from escaping, killed while pursuing her and Catelyn.

relationships.Brienne of Tarth: Dies trying to stop her escape

ser-emmon-cuy.name: Emmon Cuy
aliases: The Yellow of Renly's Rainbow Guard

22.description: Member of Renly's Rainbow Guard wearing yellow, dedicated to protecting his king.

29.description: Witnesses the impossible death of Renly and struggles to understand what happened.

33.description: Dies alongside Robar Royce trying to prevent Brienne and Catelyn's escape.

ser-parmen-crane.name: Parmen Crane
aliases: The Purple of Renly's Rainbow Guard

22.description: Member of Renly's Rainbow Guard wearing purple, one of seven elite knights protecting the king.

29.description: Present during Renly's death, helpless to prevent the shadow assassination.

16.description: Lord of Highgarden and Warden of the South, brings the vast power of the Reach to support Renly's claim.

22.description: Commands the largest army in Westeros, making Renly's cause seem unstoppable.

62.description: After events at Storm's End, allies with the Lannisters and helps save King's Landing at the Blackwater.

16.description: Mace Tyrell's mother, a sharp-tongued old woman known for her wit and political acumen.

62.description: Helps negotiate the Lannister-Tyrell alliance after the Blackwater victory.

16.description: Second son of Mace Tyrell, known for his skill at arms and gallant nature.

62.description: Participates in the relief of King's Landing, fighting alongside the Lannister forces.

29.description: Castellan of Storm's End who refuses to surrender the castle to Stannis after recent events.

33.description: Holds Storm's End against Stannis's siege, protecting Edric Storm from being used.

42.description: Dies mysteriously, falling from Storm's End's walls, allowing Stannis to take the castle.

16.description: Reach lord who supports Renly's claim to the throne, bringing his forces to the cause.

29.description: Must decide his allegiance after sudden changes, along with other Reach lords.

33.description: Robert Baratheon's acknowledged bastard son, kept safe at Storm's End under Cortnay Penrose's protection.

42.description: Becomes Stannis's ward after Storm's End falls, though Melisandre shows disturbing interest in his royal blood.

relationships.Melisandre: Shows ominous interest in his blood

33.description: Knight of House Estermont who helps guard Edric Storm at Storm's End.

42.description: Continues to serve as Edric's guardian after Stannis takes Storm's End.

33.description: Knight serving at Storm's End, part of the castle's garrison.

42.description: Remains at Storm's End after it falls to Stannis, serving the new regime.

33.description: Maester serving at Storm's End, tending to the castle's needs during the siege.

42.description: Continues his duties at Storm's End under Stannis's control.

33.description: Former smith at Storm's End who lost his arm in Robert's service, mentioned in discussions of the castle's defenses.

43.description: Former crow who deserted the Night's Watch and united the wildling clans. Now leads a massive army beyond the Wall.
Boisterous wildling war leader with red hair and beard. Known for his tall tales and fierce loyalty to Mance.
Wildling raider who wears armor made of bones and rules through fear. Distrusts Jon Snow's conversion.

23.description: Vicious wildling raider known for his cruelty. His band has been attacking villages south of the Wall.

43.description: Fierce spearwife leader who commands respect among the wildlings. Known for her tactical skills.
Leader of the Thenns, the most disciplined and organized of the wildling clans. Rules with absolute authority.
Powerful skinchanger who controls multiple animals. One of the most feared wildlings beyond the Wall.

39.description: Wildling skinchanger who can control an eagle. Killed by Jon Snow but his consciousness lives on in the bird.

23.description: Legendary ranger of the Night's Watch who lost half his sword hand but adapted to fight with his left. Leads the ranging beyond the Wall.

39.description: Orders Jon to kill him to maintain Jon's cover among the wildlings. Dies to save the mission.

43.description: Dalla's sister, considered a princess among the wildlings. Beautiful and fierce.
Mance Rayder's pregnant wife. Represents the hope for the wildling future.

23.description: One of Craster's daughter-wives who is pregnant. Shows kindness to the Night's Watch.

6.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, respected leader planning the Great Ranging beyond the Wall.

23.description: Leads the Great Ranging with three hundred men to investigate the wildling threat and find Benjen Stark.

6.description: Cowardly but intelligent member of the Night's Watch. Jon's closest friend and maester-in-training.

23.description: Joins the Great Ranging despite his fears. Shows growing courage when facing the unknown.

6.description: Master-at-arms of the Night's Watch who despises Jon Snow. Sent to King's Landing with proof of the Others.

60.description: Arrives in King's Landing during the Battle of Blackwater with a wight's hand as proof of the supernatural threat.

6.description: Lord Steward of the Night's Watch, responsible for provisions and supplies. Cautious and practical.

23.description: Acting First Ranger after Benjen Stark's disappearance. Elderly but experienced ranger leading scouts.
Ranger commander participating in the Great Ranging. Ambitious and eager for glory against the wildlings.
Experienced ranger leading one of the scouting parties during the Great Ranging beyond the Wall.
Perpetually pessimistic steward of the Night's Watch known for his dark humor and gloomy predictions.

6.description: Strong but slow-witted member of the Night's Watch. One of Jon Snow's loyal friends and allies.
Small, quick-witted member of the Night's Watch. Former minstrel who became one of Jon's closest friends.

23.description: Wildling who lives north of the Wall and marries his own daughters. Provides shelter to the Night's Watch but is deeply disturbing.
One of Craster's many daughter-wives. Represents the horror of Craster's household arrangements.
Another of Craster's daughter-wives, showing the disturbing pattern of his household.
Dangerous member of the Night's Watch with criminal background. Shows contempt for authority.
Simple-minded but gentle giant of a man in the Night's Watch. Despite his size, he's called 'Small' Paul.
Dog keeper at Castle Black who harbors resentment against his superiors. Known for his cruel nature.
Member of the Night's Watch from the Three Sisters, involved in the discontent growing among the brothers.
Skilled scout of the Night's Watch known for moving quietly. Valuable member of the ranging party.

27.description: Wealthy merchant prince of Qarth, member of the Thirteen. Offers marriage to Daenerys and promises great riches.

40.description: Shows Daenerys the wonders of Qarth while pursuing his suit. His palace displays incredible wealth and luxury.

63.description: Provides ships for Daenerys to leave Qarth after her confrontation with the warlocks.

27.description: Blue-lipped warlock of Qarth who welcomes Daenerys to the city. Speaks mysteriously of prophecies.

48.description: Reveals he and the other warlocks have taken Daenerys's dragons to the House of the Undying to strengthen their magic.

63.description: Burned alive by dragonfire when Daenerys rescues her dragons from the House of the Undying.

27.description: Wealthy member of the Thirteen of Qarth. Deals in exotic spices from across the known world.
Member of the Thirteen who controls much of Qarth's copper trade. Wears elaborate copper ornaments.
One of the Thirteen who trades in the finest silks. His robes are made of the most exquisite fabrics.
Known as 'The Exquisite', a member of the Thirteen famous for his refined taste and beauty.
Member of the Thirteen known as the 'Milk Man', presumably for his trade in dairy products or his pale complexion.

57.description: Ancient wizards dwelling in the House of the Undying, sustained by shade of the evening. They appear as corpse-like figures.

63.description: Burned to death by Daenerys's dragons when she rescues them from the House of the Undying.

57.description: The blue drink that sustains the warlocks, made from the leaves of the evening trees. It stains lips blue and enhances magical sight.
Daenerys sees a vision of her brother Rhaegar in the House of the Undying, speaking of the prince that was promised.

4.description: Exiled knight from the North who serves as Daenerys's most trusted advisor. Helps lead the khalasar through the Red Waste.

27.description: Advises caution with the Qartheen but supports Daenerys in her negotiations with the Thirteen.

57.description: Accompanies Daenerys into the House of the Undying to rescue her dragons, showing his unwavering loyalty.

4.description: Young Dothraki bloodrider sworn to Daenerys, skilled with the whip. Helps protect the khaleesi in the Red Waste.

27.description: Remains loyal to Daenerys in Qarth, though uncomfortable in the strange city far from the Dothraki sea.

4.description: Dothraki bloodrider skilled with the bow, one of Daenerys's three bloodriders. Helps hunt for food in the Red Waste.

27.description: Stands guard over Daenerys in Qarth, maintaining Dothraki traditions in the foreign city.

4.description: One of Daenerys's three bloodriders, young and loyal. Scouts ahead through the dangerous Red Waste.

12.description: Dies in the Red Waste while scouting, his body returned headless to the khalasar - a great dishonor.

4.description: Young Dothraki handmaid who serves Daenerys faithfully. Helps care for the dragons and tends to the khaleesi.

27.description: Adapts to life in Qarth while continuing to serve Daenerys, maintaining Dothraki customs.

4.description: Dothraki handmaid who remains with Daenerys through their trials. Skilled at braiding hair and caring for horses.

27.description: Continues her service in Qarth, helping Daenerys navigate the strange customs of the city.

4.description: Former pleasure slave from Lys who serves as Daenerys's handmaid. Weakens during the harsh journey through the Red Waste.

12.description: Dies in the Red Waste from exhaustion and thirst, unable to endure the harsh conditions of the desert.

63.description: Powerful eunuch warrior sent by Illyrio Mopatis to protect Daenerys. Former fighting pit champion with many scars.

27.description: Mysterious masked woman from Asshai who speaks in riddles and prophecies to Daenerys.

40.description: Continues to appear to Daenerys with mysterious warnings about those around her and the path ahead.

63.description: Experienced ship captain from Pentos who brings ships to carry Daenerys from Qarth.

27.description: Merchant captain who trades in Qarth's port, representing the many foreign traders drawn to the city's wealth.

40.description: Guild of assassins in Qarth who apologize before they kill. They attempt to murder Daenerys in her chambers.

48.description: Make further attempts on Daenerys's life, showing the growing danger she faces in Qarth.

27.description: Ancient noble families of Qarth who trace their bloodlines back to the city's founding. They initially refuse Daenerys entry.

40.description: Represent old Qarth traditions and view the Thirteen as upstart merchants, creating political tensions in the city.

63.description: Wealthy magister of Pentos who sends Strong Belwas and Arstan Whitebeard to find and protect Daenerys.
Elderly man claiming to be a simple squire, sent by Illyrio to serve Daenerys. His true identity remains mysterious.

5.description: Baker's boy from King's Landing traveling with Yoren's Night's Watch recruits. Fat and frightened but tries to act tough.

9.description: Captured along with the other recruits by Lannister forces. Terrified of what will happen to them.

64.description: Escapes Harrenhal with Arya and Gendry when Jaqen helps them flee. Still dreams of baking bread.

5.description: Dyer's apprentice from King's Landing, traveling with Yoren's Night's Watch recruits. Young and green to the world.

9.description: Wounded in the leg during the attack, cannot walk. Killed by Raff the Sweetling when he can't keep up with the other prisoners.
Small orphan girl found among the prisoners. Cries constantly and can barely speak, having witnessed horrible things.

relationships.Arya Stark: Protected by, takes the name 'Weasel' herself

14.description: Brought to Harrenhal with the other prisoners. Still weeps constantly and hardly speaks, traumatized by the war.

5.description: Mysterious man from Lorath, one of three dangerous prisoners in a cage, traveling with Yoren's group. Speaks of himself in third person.

9.description: Freed from the burning wagon by Arya during the attack. Owes her three deaths for saving three lives.

14.description: Now serving at Harrenhal, having changed his appearance. A servant who can kill with mysterious skill.

30.description: Kills the Tickler as Arya's first death. Shows he can kill anyone, anywhere, demonstrating his lethal abilities.

47.description: Kills Ser Amory Lorch as Arya's second death, saving her from exposure. His methods remain mysterious.

64.description: Uses his third death cleverly to help Arya escape Harrenhal. Changes faces mysteriously before departing.

5.description: Vicious criminal with a missing nose, one of three dangerous prisoners traveling with Yoren. Threatens to rape and kill.

9.description: Freed by Arya during the attack. Shows no gratitude and remains as brutal and threatening as before.

14.description: Now at Harrenhal serving the Lannisters. Still as cruel and violent, terrorizing other prisoners.

5.description: Savage man with filed teeth who literally bites people. One of three dangerous prisoners, more beast than man.

9.description: Freed during the attack, immediately begins killing with his teeth. Completely feral and bloodthirsty.

14.description: Serving at Harrenhal, uses his teeth as weapons. Other prisoners fear him more than the guards.
Harrenhal understeward who oversees the servants. Cruel and petty, enjoys making others miserable.

30.description: Found dead, killed by Jaqen H'ghar as Arya's first death. His cruelty finally catches up to him.

14.description: Pretty serving girl at Harrenhal who has been repeatedly abused by soldiers. Broken teeth and bruises mark her suffering.

47.description: Continues to suffer abuse under changing leadership at Harrenhal. Shows the war's impact on innocent smallfolk.

14.description: Smith working at Harrenhal, his thumb blackened from years of working the forge. Skilled with metalwork.

47.description: Continues his work under the changing masters of Harrenhal. Tries to keep his head down and survive.

14.description: Armorer at Harrenhal, maintains and repairs weapons and armor for the garrison. Skilled craftsman.

47.description: Adapts to serve new masters as control of Harrenhal changes hands. His skills make him valuable to any lord.

5.description: One of the Mountain's men who attacks Yoren's group. Cruel soldier who enjoys violence against the weak.

9.description: Steals Needle from Arya after the attack, not knowing its significance. Joins in the brutal treatment of prisoners.

relationships.Arya Stark: Took Needle from, doesn't know her identity

14.description: Now stationed at Harrenhal, continues to serve the Lannister cause with casual brutality.

5.description: Mountain's man with an ironic nickname, anything but sweet. Participates in the brutal attack on Yoren's group.

9.description: Kills Lommy Greenhands in cold blood when the wounded boy can't keep up. Shows no mercy to children.

14.description: Stationed at Harrenhal, continues his cruel service to the Lannisters without remorse.

5.description: Lannister torturer who questions prisoners about gold and Lord Beric. Uses pain to extract information.

9.description: Continues his questioning of prisoners with his signature questions about gold and Beric Dondarrion.

14.description: At Harrenhal, continues his brutal interrogation methods. His repetitive questions haunt those who hear them.

30.description: Killed by Jaqen H'ghar as Arya's first death. His reign of terror ends suddenly and mysteriously.

5.description: One of the Mountain's men participating in the attack on Yoren's group. Follows orders without question.

9.description: Helps guard the prisoners taken from Yoren's group. Shows the casual cruelty typical of Lannister forces.

14.description: Stationed at Harrenhal as part of the garrison. Continues his service under Tywin Lannister's command.
Crude soldier at Harrenhal known for his foul language and vulgar behavior. His name fits his personality.

47.description: Adapts to serve new masters as Harrenhal changes hands. His crude nature remains constant.

14.description: Lannister soldier at Harrenhal who tells cruel stories and enjoys the suffering of others. Laughs at violence.

30.description: Dies suddenly under mysterious circumstances, actually killed by Jaqen H'ghar fulfilling a death debt.

14.description: Depraved septon who accompanies Lannister forces. His holy vows hide darker urges, particularly toward children.

47.description: Continues his depraved behavior under different masters. Shows how war attracts and hides the worst of humanity.

26.description: Disgraced former maester found at Harrenhal, now serving as healer. His experiments went too far for the Citadel.

47.description: Adapts to serve new masters while continuing his healing work and secret experiments.
Leader of the Brave Companions sellswords, known as 'The Goat' for his distinctive lisp. Switches sides from Lannister to Bolton.

50.description: Takes control of Harrenhal for Roose Bolton. His company of misfits and criminals brings chaos to the castle.

64.description: Becomes Jaqen's third death target, allowing Arya to escape. His betrayals finally catch up to him.

47.description: Fat Dothraki sellsword in the Brave Companions. Speaks broken Common Tongue and follows Vargo Hoat's lead.

relationships.Dothraki: Origin from the Great Grass Sea

50.description: Helps secure Harrenhal for the Brave Companions. His Dothraki fighting style intimidates the garrison.

47.description: Ironically nicknamed 'Faithful' sellsword in the Brave Companions. His loyalty only extends as far as his pay.

50.description: Helps enforce the Brave Companions' control over Harrenhal. Shows why his 'faithful' nickname is ironic.

47.description: Psychotic jester among the Brave Companions who finds killing amusing. His jokes are as twisted as his mind.

50.description: Continues his disturbing blend of humor and violence at Harrenhal. His presence makes everyone nervous.

47.description: Dornish criminal among the Brave Companions. His past crimes earned him a place with this company of misfits.

50.description: Helps maintain the Brave Companions' brutal control over Harrenhal. His criminal nature fits the company.

47.description: One of the Brave Companions sellswords following Vargo Hoat. Another criminal finding refuge in the company.

50.description: Participates in the occupation of Harrenhal. Shows the caliber of men the Brave Companions attract.

47.description: Archer in the Brave Companions, presumably missing two toes. Skilled with a bow despite his disability.

50.description: Uses his archery skills to help control Harrenhal. His disability doesn't affect his deadly accuracy.

relationships.Escapees: Potential threat to any who flee

14.description: Northern lord captured at Duskendale, now held prisoner at Harrenhal. Brother to Galbart Glover of Deepwood Motte.

47.description: Remains imprisoned as Harrenhal changes hands. His capture represents the Northern losses in the war.

relationships.Current Captors: Valuable prisoner to whoever controls Harrenhal

14.description: Member of House Frey captured while fighting for Robb Stark. Held prisoner at Harrenhal with other northern nobles.

47.description: His imprisonment shows not all Freys remained loyal to their lord's shifting allegiances. Some paid the price.

33.description: Daughter of House Frey known as 'Gatehouse Ami'. Represents the complex web of Riverlands politics.

42.description: Navigates the changing allegiances of the Riverlands as the war affects all noble houses.

33.description: Minor lord of the Riverlands trying to navigate the complex politics of the war. His lands suffer from the conflict.

42.description: Struggles with choosing sides as various armies march through the Riverlands. His survival depends on backing the winner.

14.description: Another member of House Frey captured while serving Robb Stark's cause. Shows the complex Frey loyalties during the war.

47.description: His continued imprisonment reflects how some Freys remained loyal to their oaths despite their lord's ambitions.

36.description: A knight of King's Landing who was stripped of lands and titles by King Joffrey for arriving drunk to a tournament. Sansa convinced Joffrey to spare his life by making him a fool instead.

50.description: Approaches Sansa secretly in the godswood, claiming to be a true knight who wants to help her escape King's Landing. His offer seems suspicious but desperate.

3.description: A minor lady at court with two daughters. Constantly trying to arrange marriages for them, particularly pursuing Tyrion as a match.
Lady Tanda's elder daughter, already married. Less of a concern for her mother's marriage schemes than her sister.
Lady Tanda's younger daughter, described as simple-minded and unwed. Her mother desperately seeks a husband for her.

44.description: Becomes a victim during the riot in King's Landing, suffering terrible abuse at the hands of the mob.

3.description: A knight married to Falyse Stokeworth. Part of the minor nobility at court.
An exiled prince from the Summer Isles who has been at the Red Keep for years, seeking support to reclaim his homeland. Known for his colorful feathered cloak and dark skin.

8.description: The royal court's fool, known for his motley and jingling bells. Performs for the entertainment of the court.

36.description: A very fat fool who entertains at court. Known for his enormous size and comedic performances.

44.description: One of three Kettleblack brothers who serve the crown. Becomes a member of the Kingsguard after the Battle of the Blackwater.
Middle brother of the Kettleblacks, serves as an officer in the City Watch under the new command structure.
Youngest of the three Kettleblack brothers. All three brothers are known for their loyalty to whoever pays them best.

3.description: A brutal member of the City Watch, one of the gold cloaks known for his harsh methods and cruelty.

60.description: A skilled knight who fights bravely during the Battle of the Blackwater. Known for his honor and martial prowess.

62.description: After proving himself in battle, he is chosen to join the Kingsguard to fill one of the vacant positions.

58.description: A knight fighting for Stannis Baratheon during his assault on King's Landing. Part of Stannis's landing forces.
A lord who supports Stannis Baratheon's claim. His forces participate in the assault on King's Landing.

65.description: Captured after the defeat at the Blackwater. His fate depends on bending the knee or facing execution.

58.description: Master of Ships for Stannis Baratheon, commands part of his fleet during the attack on King's Landing.
A lord from the Crownlands who supports Stannis's claim to the Iron Throne. Participates in the assault on the capital.

60.description: A knight who is severely wounded during the Battle of the Blackwater, losing part of his arm in the fighting.
A knight who fights during the Battle of the Blackwater, one of the many participants in the chaotic battle.

8.description: One of the pyromancers working under Wisdom Hallyne to create wildfire for the defense of King's Landing.
A pyromancer who served the Mad King Aerys. Mentioned as one of those who helped create the wildfire caches that were never used during Robert's Rebellion.

44.description: The grossly fat High Septon who is killed by the mob during the riot in King's Landing. His death shows how the common people have turned against all authority.

3.description: A young Lannister cousin who was recently married to Lady Ermesande Hayford, an infant bride, in one of Tyrion's political arrangements.

44.description: Goes missing during the riot in King's Landing. His disappearance is one of the many tragedies of that day.

3.description: An infant girl who was married to Tyrek Lannister as part of political maneuvering. The marriage secures her lands for House Lannister.

44.description: A member of the Kingsguard who is killed by the mob during the riot in King's Landing while trying to protect members of the royal party.
The master-at-arms of the Red Keep who is killed during the riot in King's Landing. His death represents the breakdown of order in the capital.

37.description: A foul-smelling servant who accompanies the Dreadfort men. He appears twisted and broken, speaking in a disturbing manner.

61.description: Revealed to be Ramsay Snow, the bastard son of Roose Bolton, who had been posing as his own servant. He is cruel and sadistic, having orchestrated much suffering.

37.description: The widow of Lord Halys Hornwood, now vulnerable without a strong male heir to protect her lands and rights.

46.description: Forced into marriage by Ramsay Snow, who seeks to claim her lands.

35.description: The young daughter of Ser Rodrik Cassel, master-at-arms of Winterfell. She is among those taken captive when Theon seizes the castle.

52.description: Witnesses the execution of her father by Theon's men, experiencing the horror of seeing her family destroyed by someone she once knew.

35.description: The grizzled master-at-arms of Winterfell, known for his loyalty to House Stark and his distinctive white whiskers. He is captured when Theon takes the castle.

52.description: Returns to try to retake Winterfell with northern forces but is captured. He dies defiant, cursing Theon for his betrayal of the Starks who raised him.

relationships.Theon Greyjoy: Former ward who betrayed the Starks

35.description: One of the Frey wards at Winterfell, called 'Little' to distinguish him from his cousin. He and his cousin are among those held captive by Theon.

52.description: Shows his cruel nature by enjoying the violence and executions at Winterfell, revealing the darker side of House Frey's character.

35.description: The other Frey ward at Winterfell, called 'Big' though he's actually younger than his cousin. He's held captive along with the Stark children.

52.description: Less enthusiastic about the violence than his cousin, showing some restraint though still loyal to House Frey's interests.

35.description: A young serving girl at Winterfell who is caught up in Theon's conquest of the castle. She shows loyalty to the Starks.

37.description: Tries to help Theon by providing information and service, though she remains fearful of the ironborn occupiers and what they might do.

35.description: Another serving girl at Winterfell who must now serve the ironborn occupiers. She works alongside Kyra in the castle.

46.description: Continues to serve in the occupied castle while trying to avoid trouble with the ironborn soldiers and their increasingly desperate situation.

37.description: An ironborn raider who followed Theon to Winterfell. He is part of the small force trying to hold the ancient castle of the Starks.

52.description: Growing increasingly unhappy with their isolated position at Winterfell, questioning the wisdom of Theon's reckless plan to hold the castle.

37.description: Another ironborn warrior in Theon's small force occupying Winterfell. He helps maintain control over the castle and its people.

61.description: Part of the dwindling ironborn garrison as their situation becomes hopeless and men begin to desert or consider abandoning Theon.

35.description: Daughter of Lord Howland Reed of Greywater Watch, she arrives at Winterfell with her brother. She is skilled with net and spear, a capable young woman.

53.description: Proves her worth as a protector, helping to keep Bran safe during the chaos at Winterfell. She is brave and resourceful in dangerous situations.

relationships.Jojen Reed: Works with brother to help Bran

35.description: Son of Howland Reed, he possesses green dreams that show him glimpses of possible futures. He is small and serious, with an otherworldly presence.

53.description: Helps Bran understand his wolf dreams and growing powers, explaining that Bran has the gift of the greensight and must learn to use it.

21.description: A simple-minded stable boy at Winterfell, enormously tall and strong but only able to say 'Hodor.' He is gentle despite his size and helps carry Bran.

61.description: Continues to carry Bran faithfully even in the most dangerous situations, proving his unwavering loyalty to the young lord despite his simple mind.

21.description: A wildling woman captured south of the Wall who now serves at Winterfell. She is cunning and knows the ways of survival in the wild.

61.description: Helps the Stark boys escape Winterfell during its burning, using her knowledge of the wild to keep them safe. She takes special care of young Rickon.

21.description: Bran's direwolf, growing large and strong. Through their bond, Bran can see through Summer's eyes and experience the wolf's senses and instincts.

53.description: The connection between Bran and Summer grows stronger, allowing Bran to slip into the wolf's consciousness more easily and see the world through wolf eyes.

35.description: Rickon's direwolf, black and fierce with green eyes. He is wilder and more aggressive than the other direwolves, reflecting his young master's nature.

61.description: Becomes increasingly wild and difficult to control, showing the savage nature that emerges when direwolves are stressed or their pack is threatened.

21.description: The wise and loyal maester of Winterfell, who has served House Stark faithfully for many years. He provides counsel and medical care to the Stark family.

61.description: Dies defending Winterfell and its people, remaining loyal to House Stark until the end. His death marks the end of the old order at the ancient castle.

21.description: An ancient servant of Winterfell who tells stories of the old times, including tales of the Others and the long night. She is Hodor's great-grandmother.

35.description: Among the castle folk taken captive when Theon seizes Winterfell, her ancient presence representing the long history now disrupted.

37.description: A northern lord and knight who serves House Stark loyally. He leads men in the continuing war against the Lannisters in the south.

46.description: Fighting in the northern campaign, facing danger as the war continues.

37.description: Castellan at Torrhen's Square, managing the castle while his lord kinsman fights in the war. He faces the challenge of defending the north with reduced forces.

52.description: Struggles to maintain control of Torrhen's Square as ironborn forces threaten the castle, showing the difficulty of defending the scattered north.

37.description: A young northern knight, son of Ser Helman Tallhart. He is eager to prove himself in battle and serve House Stark with honor.

52.description: Killed by ironborn forces while defending northern lands, his youth and promise cut short by the brutal realities of war.
A young northern lord who remains loyal to House Stark. He attempts to gather forces to help reclaim Winterfell from Theon's occupation.

61.description: Killed attempting to retake Winterfell, his death representing the cost of loyalty and the tragedy of young lords dying in a hopeless cause.

37.description: A local miller who operates near Winterfell. He has a wife and two young sons who work the mill with him.

46.description: A local miller caught up in the conflicts around Winterfell.

37.description: The miller's wife who once knew Theon during his time at Winterfell. She represents the common folk caught in the nobility's conflicts.

46.description: A miller's wife caught up in the turmoil around Winterfell.
The miller's two young sons, innocent children who work at their father's mill near Winterfell.

52.description: Killed by Theon's men and their bodies used in a terrible deception to make it appear that Bran and Rickon Stark are dead, showing the depths of war's cruelty.

45.description: One of Lord Walder Frey's bastard sons, identified among the Frey forces gathering for the war.

59.description: One of the younger Frey sons, mentioned among those gathering for the war effort.

33.description: Lady of House Darry, mentioned among the noble houses affected by the war in the Riverlands.
Lord of House Darry, his lands ravaged by the Mountain's raids in the Riverlands.
Lord Vance, one of the Riverlands lords whose lands have been attacked by the Mountain and his men.
An elderly lord of House Vance, blind with age, mentioned among the Riverlands nobility.

37.description: Theon's young mute squire, who serves him loyally though he cannot speak.

24.description: An ironborn warrior known by his unusual name, mentioned among Asha's followers.
A young ironborn lord mentioned among those at the kingsmoot discussions on Pyke.
An ironborn mentioned among those building ships for Balon's fleet.

46.description: One of the ironborn warriors serving in Theon's small force at Winterfell.

3.description: A member of the Kingsguard, though his courage and honor are questionable.

20.description: Stripped of his white cloak and dismissed from the Kingsguard by Tyrion for cowardice.

3.description: A cruel member of the Kingsguard known for his harsh treatment of others.

8.description: A member of the Kingsguard, considered more honorable than some of his brothers.

62.description: A Dornish noble lady mentioned among those at court.

59.description: A knight of the Rainwood mentioned among those fighting in the battles.

12.description: The first Targaryen king who conquered Westeros with his dragons, referenced in prophecies and histories.

21.description: Legendary ancient Stark who built Winterfell and the Wall, referenced in old stories.

3.description: Legendary founder of House Lannister, said to have swindled Casterly Rock from the Casterlys through trickery.

22.description: Legendary figure of the Reach, said to be the ancestor of many noble houses and bringer of fertility.

7.description: Robb Stark's direwolf, a large and fierce grey wolf that accompanies him in his campaigns.

54.description: Sansa's direwolf, killed by Ned Stark on Robert's orders, remembered with sadness.

8.description: An old black tomcat that prowls the Red Keep, named after Aegon's great dragon.

30.description: A serving girl at an inn, mentioned among the common folk affected by the war.

51.description: A woman from Mole's Town, mentioned among those near the Wall.

36.description: A woods witch mentioned in passing, known for her prophecies and strange knowledge.

recaps.1: Tyrion arrives in King's Landing to serve as Hand while Tywin fights in the Riverlands.
recaps.2: Arya disguised as 'Arry' travels with Yoren's Night's Watch recruits towards the Wall.
recaps.3: Tyrion begins his tenure as acting Hand of the King, dealing with the city's challenges.
recaps.4: Daenerys leads her small khalasar through the Red Waste, her dragons growing slowly.
recaps.5: Arya's group is captured by Lannister forces. She hides her identity.
recaps.6: Jon ranges beyond the Wall with the Night's Watch, searching for missing rangers.
recaps.7: Bran continues to have strange dreams about a three-eyed crow while ruling Winterfell in Robb's absence.
recaps.8: Tyrion begins preparations for the city's defense, including the production of wildfire.
recaps.9: Arya and other prisoners are taken toward Harrenhal.
recaps.10: Davos Seaworth serves Stannis Baratheon, who claims the Iron Throne by right.
recaps.11: Theon returns to the Iron Islands after years as Ned Stark's ward.
recaps.12: Daenerys arrives at Qarth after wandering the Red Waste with her dragons.
recaps.13: Jon continues beyond the Wall with the great ranging of the Night's Watch.
recaps.14: Arya arrives at Harrenhal and becomes cupbearer to Tywin Lannister.
recaps.15: Stannis burns the sept on Dragonstone and declares for the Lord of Light.
recaps.16: Renly holds court in the Reach with massive support from the lords.
recaps.17: Davos expresses his concerns about Melisandre's influence over Stannis.
recaps.18: Theon is disappointed by his reception on Pyke and his father's plans.
recaps.19: Arya continues serving at Harrenhal, learning its dark secrets.
recaps.20: Melisandre performs rituals and speaks of the coming darkness.
recaps.21: Bran's wolf dreams become more vivid and meaningful.
recaps.22: Brienne serves in Renly's Kingsguard, mocked but skilled.
recaps.23: Jon meets Qhorin Halfhand during the ranging beyond the Wall.
recaps.24: Theon decides to capture Winterfell to prove himself to his father.
recaps.25: Stannis continues his religious conversion and preparations for war.
recaps.26: Arya witnesses the horrible treatment of prisoners at Harrenhal.
recaps.27: Daenerys is welcomed in Qarth by Xaro Xhoan Daxos and the Thirteen.
recaps.28: Jon learns more about the wildling threat from experienced rangers.
recaps.29: Shocking events occur in Renly's tent, witnessed by Brienne and Catelyn.
recaps.30: Arya uses her first 'name' with Jaqen H'ghar to kill the Tickler.
recaps.31: Davos leads Stannis's fleet toward King's Landing for the assault.
recaps.32: Theon arrives at Winterfell and takes the castle with minimal resistance.
recaps.33: Brienne is accused of killing Renly but protested by Catelyn.
recaps.34: Arya continues her dangerous game of serving Tywin while hiding her identity.
recaps.35: Bran is taken prisoner in Winterfell by Theon, his father's former ward.
recaps.36: The political situation shifts as various factions react to Renly's death.
recaps.37: Theon struggles to maintain control of Winterfell with his small force.
recaps.38: Stannis gains some of Renly's followers but faces challenges.
recaps.39: Jon is captured by wildlings including Ygritte beyond the Wall.
recaps.40: Daenerys explores Qarth and its wonders, but danger lurks.
recaps.41: Davos prepares for the assault on King's Landing with mixed feelings.
recaps.42: Brienne swears service to Catelyn and vows to find her daughters.
recaps.43: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder and must prove his loyalty to survive.
recaps.44: Political maneuvering continues in King's Landing as war approaches.
recaps.45: Stannis's forces prepare for their assault on the capital.
recaps.46: Theon takes Bran and the other Stark children as prisoners in Winterfell.
recaps.47: Arya uses her second name on Ser Amory Lorch after he nearly discovers her.
recaps.48: Daenerys discovers her dragons have been stolen and taken to the House of the Undying.
recaps.49: Various factions position themselves for the coming battle.
recaps.50: Arya continues to navigate the dangers of Harrenhal.
recaps.51: Jon's infiltration of the wildling forces continues as he gets closer to Ygritte.
recaps.52: Theon's position in Winterfell becomes more precarious.
recaps.53: Bran's connection to his direwolf and his dreams grows stronger.
recaps.54: Preparations for battle intensify across the realm.
recaps.55: Arya makes more dangerous moves within Harrenhal.
recaps.56: Jon deepens his cover among the wildlings while Theon faces challenges.
recaps.57: Daenerys prepares to enter the House of the Undying to recover her dragons.
recaps.58: The Battle of the Blackwater begins with Davos leading the fleet into Tyrion's wildfire trap.
recaps.59: The battle continues with massive destruction from the wildfire explosion.
recaps.60: Tyrion leads the defense of King's Landing during the ground assault.
recaps.61: Winterfell burns as Theon's men desert him, and Bran escapes with the others.
recaps.62: The Battle of the Blackwater concludes with Tywin and the Tyrells saving the city.
recaps.63: Daenerys escapes the House of the Undying with her dragons, burning the warlocks.
recaps.64: Arya escapes Harrenhal with Hot Pie and Gendry using her third name cleverly.
recaps.65: Stannis retreats to Dragonstone after his defeat at the Blackwater.
recaps.66: Theon's fate at Winterfell becomes unclear as various forces converge.
recaps.67: The aftermath of the Blackwater battle reshapes the political landscape.
recaps.68: Jon continues his dangerous mission among the wildlings as winter approaches.
recaps.69: Arya and her companions flee toward an uncertain future.
recaps.70: The war continues with new alliances and enmities formed from the battle's outcome.
